title: Cyclist Magazine Podcast episode 90: SD Worx’s Anna Shackley is Britain’s next cycling star
content:
Cyclist
Cyclist Magazine Podcast episode 90: SD Worx’s Anna Shackley is Britain’s next cycling star

For this week’s episode of the Cyclist Magazine Podcast, Emma and Will are joined by the formidable Anna Shackley who rides for SD Worx and, at just 22 years old, has had a glittering summer.

Often the domestique due to her age and the quality of her team, she won the under-23 race at the British National Championships (and placed 5th overall) and finished third place in the under-23 race at her home World Championships in Scotland, second overall at the first Tour de l’Avenir Femmes, top 10 at the Tour de Romandie (supporting teammate Demi Vollering to victory) and second at the under-23 European Championships.

Not bad, hey? Shackley chats about her role within the super team, what it’s like riding among some of the biggest names in the sport and, ultimately, where she sees herself progressing.

She is also candid about the jump from junior level to the WorldTour, the lack of women’s U23 races as well as the issues in the UK racing scene and what needs to be done to nurture youngsters coming up the ranks. 

Interview starts at 5:45.
